pros: Teamwork, benefits, flexible schedules, great administration. Great way to progress you career in the nursing industry!
cons: As with any 24/7 facility, Martha & Mary is open 365 days a year.

pros: There are a lot of amazing and hard working staff in kitchen, EVS, hospitality, nursing and basically any of the jobs paying 20 or below here at MMHC. Having a job that gives back to the community is a positive Meeting so many people who feel the same way is a positive
cons: There is very little room for wage improvement. There are people who have been here 5 years or more and are barely receiving a wage that represents the market now. Many of them are receiving less than I am and have been here longer. A lot of our employees are visa and green card workers, who speak second languages. This seems to be used against them like telling us we cant talk about wages or that if we clock out early we can get 15 min deducted from our pay. HR doesn't seem to want to talk about this or even seem to care. On top of the lack of communication and transparency from the higher ups we experience a distressing amount of employee turnover and low morale. If we could even get a living wage maybe these other things wouldn't be so unbearable. Per WA employment website a living wage in Poulsbo is 27 an hour. Even as a non profit there must be ways to adjust our wages to reflect cost of living better Management wont talk to me about a living wage. I've talked to my direct supervisor, I've emailed HR 2x and I still have not heard anything back

pros: The nurses, evs, social workers, activities, dietary, front desk staff...are amazing. I have made some great friends here.
cons: The place has gone downhill over the past few years because of the so called leadership. If you are related to/friends with the CEO you will love working here, you will get promoted and can do what you please. Leadership likes to place blame and point fingers rather than work together to solve problems. Overworked employees in a hostile work environment do not mix well. We will see how long it lasts.

pros: There are no pro to be had

pros: Nice people and community! Felt like family

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Bremerton, WA

pros: There's so much flexibility in scheduling for work-life balance. I love that they offer loan forgiveness for employees that want to move up in Nursing or Children's Services.  Martha & Mary has been a stable employer in the Kitsap County region for 125 years.
cons: The pay is awful.  I get that it's a non-profit, but not paying employees enough to live in the community they work is not the way to inspire loyalty.  The high turnover and low wages bring in new employees that aren't necessarily the best suited for the positions or the company, making long-time employees' morale suffer.  If you're in an administrative role, don't expect a lot of support from senior leadership.

pros:
In 2013, knowing that we were moving to WA from the East Coast, I applied online for a position with Martha & Mary.  At the time, I was leaving a for-profit, large/widespread corporate childcare company, and quite honestly had become a bit jaded and burned out.  From the first face I met at Martha & Mary, and every interaction I had thereafter, I realized there is something very different about this company.  The history, the heart, the commitment to community, and the mission which reside at the core of this company truly are unique.  While it's a large & well-known company in Kitsap County, it still has a family-like feeling in many ways.  I always felt like my voice was heard, and my opinions were respected.  My supervisor & peers were respectful, hard-working and supportive, and together we truly built a team environment.  

Previous reviews mentioned compensation, and I know that steps have been taken even in the past few years to assess and improve in this area, as well as in regards to employee recognition.  And what M&M is not able to offer monetarily, it is made up for in other ways.
cons: The company has grown and changed a lot over the past few years, which has caused the job descriptions, technology, communication, and expectations to change as well.  Change is necessary for progress, but always comes with some unrest.  It's important that changes are well thought-out with input from multiple directions/perspectives, and well-communicated at all levels.  Any company with 125 year history is going to have "growing pains" and learning experiences while evolving to meet the changing needs of the community they serve.

job_title: Prefer Not to Give in Poulsbo, WA
pros: It's a company that has been around for over 100 years. People are cheerful and nice.
cons:
There is a complete void of leadership. For the most part, if you are “nice” it doesn’t matter how bad you are at your job, how much money or time you waste, etc. You might be put to work managing things you aren’t equipped or trained for (including other staff), you can be a poor implementer, or just stay without having to do much (or hire a contractor to do it). Basically, talent management and accountability are non-existent. 
If this isn’t bad enough, they’ve literally done everything they can to make sure employees know they are the lowest priority… The benefits are lousy (there are only two paid holidays, there is no retirement benefit match, and compensation is in the lowest 10th percentile, they don't support new staff with sick days or paid time off (so they work sick or leave their kids at home when they shouldn’t because they don't accrue any for months, which is incredible for a care provider).  
Overall, management seems less interested in doing things well than in just pretending to care and being really, really nice, rather than implementing changes or improvements. New employees often just “give up” soon after they are hired and go through the motions until they can leave.

job_title: Nursing Scheduler, Mary Ann Best-Rabonza in Poulsbo, WA
pros: From the upper management to the subordinates, everyone works together professionally and welcomes new employees as if part of the "M&M" family!  Only resigned due to the demands of the pursuit of a MBA-Strategic Leadership.

job_title: Operations Manager in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Great company. Treats ee's with respect and honor. Challenging roles
cons: Continue to keep employees updated on state of the overall company. Continue to do what's right and keep the culture the founders started so long ago!!
